wikipedia_page.main: Timothée Jordan (born 27 February 1865, date of death unknown) was a member of the silver medal winning French cricket team at the 1900 Summer Olympics, the only time to date that cricket has featured in the Olympics. He opened the batting for France in the only game against Great Britain, scoring 11 in the French first innings and a duck in the second.
